newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Jackie Chan leads HK protest against film piracy.
newsitem.headline: Jackie Chan leads HK protest against film piracy.

text.p: Martial arts film star Jackie Chan led a noisy protest outside Hong Kong's legislature on Wednesday to demand protection against rampant copyright piracy.
The protest drew a large crowd outside the Legislative Council in Hong Kong's bustling Central financial district as onlookers gathered for a glimpse of Chan, the king of Hong Kong's movie scene.
About 200 protesters -- who also included producers, directors, and stuntmen -- chanted slogans and took turns whipping two life-size effigies representing film copyright pirates.
"Protect the culture of the local movie industry," they shouted.
Legislators took a brief break to receive a petition from the demonstrators.
Hong Kong is notorious as a centre for trade in illegal bootlegged videotapes and compact discs, most produced in China, which sell at a mere fraction of prices for the originals.
